video.title: Web Developer Portfolio Review and Tips - Nisar
video.description:
Learn tips to improve your portfolio while watching Benjamin Spak review the portfolio and social media presence for a web developer named Nisar.

🎥 Benjamin's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQUNME_uamXEW1c58iEADWw

⚠️ Want Benjamin to Review Your Resume or Portfolio?
https://goo.gl/forms/6NM27sIuXxHAoE4y1

Connect With Benjamin 💬
👊 Discord: http://spak.co
🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/benjaminspak
⛓️ LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/benjaminspak/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: okibe ogomola
topLevelComment.text: Your page looks really nice,  how's your development  going?

topLevelComment.author: MathinusG
topLevelComment.text: Hi Nisar, I like the layout and color tones a lot. You did a good job in general. You need to rewrite the introduction copy. It's not reading well. I'ts not clear what you want to say. "I like performance as much as much as expertise?" Why would you want to say that anyway? What you can say is "I have the expertise to build a well performing site." The capitalization throughout is wrong. You can't have a question mark at the end of a sentence and then start another sentence with a lower case letter. You might be at a disadvantage if English is not your home language, but it's crucial you get the grammar right.

topLevelComment.author: Marcin Kołodziej
topLevelComment.text: Just 2 cents from me - I think this menu is taken from the Jonas Schmedtmann's CSS course. I saw a lot of portfolio sites with the exact same menu, just the different colors - you might want to customize it a little to stand out. Overall pretty solid website I guess.

topLevelComment.author: Calamity Jane
topLevelComment.text: I would definitely have a native English speaker run through and edit your text.   You have many non-standard English wordings and grammar mistakes. This will make you look unprofessional  - it is one thing to have language issues in an email or when you are speaking, but to have issues on a website, cv or resume is not ok.

replies.author: Calamity Jane
replies.text: I am afraid I am not the best person to help with something like that.  You might try starting with https://www.reddit.com/r/EnglishLearning to find someone who would be able to help.

replies.author: Nisar Hassan
replies.text: Hi! Calamity Jane Thank you for the Feed Back. Can you help me better word my site?

topLevelComment.author: TheSteelGamer
topLevelComment.text: You are more excited to give advice on Twitter then his website.

topLevelComment.author: LAMSTech Gaming
topLevelComment.text: Como alguien puede darles dislike a contenido como este que lo que busca es sumar a nuestros conocimientos más que restar....#SaludosdesdeRD

topLevelComment.author: Shinobi Tatsujin
topLevelComment.text: Cant seem to locate codecareer "dot" org... Anyone know the correct URL?

topLevelComment.author: Sebastian
topLevelComment.text: you can make a video with selenium for automation testing or you can create a video and you explain when we using automation testing? thank you !! we are very good!!

topLevelComment.author: Diego C
topLevelComment.text: If I may add, for the homepage, "I love performance as much as an expert" sounds a bit weird. Sounds like "experts" love performance but he is not an expert? or maybe he loves performance as much as he loves experts? Just a bit weird order of words. Then there's "I try my best..", that again sounds like he's doubting himself. I would perhaps reword it as "Hi, I am Nasir. I create UX rich performant websites and web applications focusing on user interactions at an expert level". Just thought it might help. Great video. Thanks.

replies.author: Sandra
replies.text: He just needs to work on his grammar!!!

topLevelComment.author: Nisar Hassan
topLevelComment.text: Thanks, Benjamin and FCC for sharing the review of My Portfolio here.

replies.author: Ash T
replies.text: I'm curious. Is your name pronounced Naseer or Nisaar?

replies.author: Moises Gonzalez
replies.text: Pretty neat job! I'd loved it.

topLevelComment.author: Andi Bensisva
topLevelComment.text: I saw his tweet asking for promotion to this portofolio. isn’t he..

replies.author: Nisar Hassan
replies.text: Yes that was me on Twitter.
